metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8339 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow in Redis 3.2.x prior to 3.2.4 causes arbitrary code execution when a crafted command is sent. An out of bounds write vulnerability exists in the handling of the client-output-buffer-limit option during the CONFIG SET command for the Redis data structure store. A crafted CONFIG SET command can lead to an out of bounds write potentially resulting in code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> according with notes in upstream patch versions are affected only after 3.2.

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1').
